message.raw:
Improved subprocess support.

It's now a lot safer, cleaner and subprocesses die when the parent is terminated via SIGINT or SIGTERM (but not if it is forceably killed or crashes...no real way to do this AFAIK)

TODO:
* finish transition away from shell=True (convert string commands to list)
* command line argument (and API option) for enabling/disabling terminal output from ffmpeg/ffprobe
* Add a hook into _agnostic_communicate so that you can process the output in real time (e.g. for a percentage complete bar!)
* test on all platforms and ensure that subprocess32 is installed correctly in readthedocs and by pip on python < 3.2

message:
Improved subprocess support.

It's now a lot safer, cleaner and subprocesses die when the parent is terminated via SIGINT or SIGTERM (but not if it is forceably killed or crashes...no real way to do this AFAIK)

TODO:
* finish transition away from shell=True (convert string commands to list)
* command line argument (and API option) for enabling/disabling terminal output from ffmpeg/ffprobe
* Add a hook into _agnostic_communicate so that you can process the output in real time (e.g. for a percentage complete bar!)
* test on all platforms and ensure that subprocess32 is installed correctly in readthedocs and by pip on python < 3.2
